page.description: Displays a Javascript alert box on the screen.

section.description: Used with the Grid, UX, AppLauncher, and Custom components

item.name: Message box text
item.description: Specify the message box text. The message text must be in the form of a Javascript expression, which means that text must be enclosed in single quotes. For example: 'You are now logged on' This example shows a message that contains a variable: 'Your user name is:' + userName

item.name: Buttons
item.description: Specify the type of message box. If you select OK-Cancel, the user selection is stored in a variable. If the user clicks OK, the variable is true, else false. Choices include.

item.name: Variable name
item.description: Specify the name of the Javascript variable that will hold the result of the message box. If the user clicks OK, this variable will be set to true, else false.

item.name: Use advanced message box
item.description: Specify if message box should use the Alpha Five message box class, rather than the built-in Javascript alert() or confirm() functions. Using the Alpha Five message box class gives you a richer set of options.

item.name: Type
item.description: Specify the message box type. Options are: no buttons, ok, ok-cancel, yes-no, yes-no-cancel, or custom if you want to define a custom collection of buttons.

item.name: Buttons justification
item.description: Specify how the buttons should be justified. Choices include *[ui:Default]*, *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Center]*, *[ui:Right]*.

item.name: OK button
item.description: Specify the Javascript to run when the button is clicked.
